tweet:
What happened to Diana amounts to torture. 

Efforts to reform our criminal justice system do not include the specific needs of women. Comprehensive legislation focused on women will be introduced soon. https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2019/08/29/pregnant-woman-diana-sanchez-birth-alone-jail-cell-denver/ …

This is a video of Diana Sanchez receiving an “absorbent pad” that looks like a napkin after her water broke in her jail cell. 

She was then forced go through hours of labor alone. 

No help. 

No doctor. 

No anything.

This is an issue of human rights. pic.twitter.com/cz3GI6wAgo
If our entire nation could experience, learn and understand our history, we would not be experiencing this resurrection of hate. #OurStory pic.twitter.com/dEDOl1ShOu

14 years ago today, Hurricane Katrina made landfall and we saw what it meant to be systematically unprepared for a disaster.

Now, the Trump administration is taking millions of dollars for disaster relief as Hurricane Dorian approaches Puerto Rico. https://www.cnn.com/2019/08/27/politics/fema-immigration-enforcement-dorian/index.html …

This hatred in inexcusable and intolerable. 

Justice must be served. https://forward.com/fast-forward/430358/brooklyn-orthodox-jewish-anti-semitic-assault/ …

When a new infrastructure project is started in South Los Angeles, it should be our community who gets the first shot at the new jobs associated with completing the project. #BuildLocalHireLocal https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/02/sen-kirsten-gillibrand-rep-bass-say-their-infrastructure-bill-boosts-local-jobs.html …
We all should learn our entire history. The good, the bad and the ugly. #OurStory https://museumandmemorial.eji.org/memorial

Today in 1955, 14 year-old Emmett Till was lynched in Mississippi. 

Lynching is still not a federal hate crime to this day, 64 years later. pic.twitter.com/TwEFfJtJmE

Last month, I visited the dungeons in Ghana where Africans who were enslaved were put on the ships.

Last weekend, I visited the fort where the first Africans who were enslaved were taken off the ships.

One word emerged as I stood at both: RESILIENCE pic.twitter.com/b61TSLLzIJ
56 years later to the day, we still dream. pic.twitter.com/tfq9WLks76

There are more than 12,500 #Dreamers in my district who need permanent protection from deportation. That is why I am proud to support #HR6, the #DreamAndPromise Act of 2019. We need #DreamAndPromiseNOW. Renew your status today! https://www.uscis.gov/humanitarian/deferred-action-childhood-arrivals-response-january-2018-preliminary-injunction …

In 2016, Black women made up 6% of the overall workforce, but only 21% of the low-wage and lowest wage workforces. This is unacceptable. 

It's time to #PayBlackWomen their worth.

#BlackWomenEqualPayDay pic.twitter.com/fzSH6Vf1dg

Our planet is burning before our eyes but we’re refusing to watch. 

We are destroying our home. pic.twitter.com/LDuvLGkMSs

The House Judiciary Committee and I will be returning to DC  to vote on legislation to ban high capacity ammunition magazines and prohibit individuals convicted of misdemeanor hate crimes from possessing firearms.

#EnoughIsEnough

Wrong on EVERY front. 1/ https://www.newsweek.com/fbi-leak-black-identity-extremist-threat-1453362 …

The price of a personal computer in 1990 was nearly $4,000. Today, you can get one for below $500.

In 1996, a vial of insulin was $21. Today it’s more than $100. Our drug costs should not be this high. 

Antavia Lee-Worsham died because of it. https://people.com/politics/rising-insulin-prices-deadly-consequences-for-diabetics/ …

To mark 400 years since the first Africans arrived in the United States, I joined @SpeakerPelosi and 13 members of @TheBlackCaucus to go back to the origins of slavery, and to reaffirm the United States' ties to Africa. pic.twitter.com/qM0EAXECte

It is shameful that in this day and age, students are deprived of access to their dreams because of their debt.

I’ve introduced legislation to cap federal interest rates and require the Department of Education to incorporate the cost of living into monthly student loan payments.

Trump's hand may not have been on the trigger in El Paso, but there is no doubt that he is responsible for inciting this violence. 

He is an embarrassment to our country. pic.twitter.com/dJt18OKr8E

Period. pic.twitter.com/zjDWpaKWt6

We must allocate the proper resources to confront it head on. pic.twitter.com/s3kcFON6Kv
